mkdir - makes a new namespace (the Fluidinfo equivalent of a directory)¶

The mkdir command may be used to create a namespace, and optionally to set its description.

FORM

[fish] mkdir path

FLAGS

  • -m description Sets the description (metadata) for a tag.

EXAMPLES

  1. Create a namespace called njr/secret

    $ touch njr/secret

  2. Create a tag njr/very/secret with description “keep right out”

    $ touch -m "keep right out"  njr/very/secret

NOTE

Namespace Tag creation is automatic on first use in fish. This command is only needed, therefore, if you wish to set permissions before use set permissions before use or specify a description.

The mkdir command cannot be used (at present) to change the description of an existing namespace.

Previous topic

mkns — makes a new namespace

Next topic

pwd — prints the name of the working directory (root user namespace)
